# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

Sure, here is a simple solution to your problem using Julia DataFrames package. 

```julia
using DataFrames

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(dt -> Dates.year(dt)*100 + Dates.month(dt), df[:dt])
    return df
end
```
This function adds a new column `ym` to the DataFrame, which is an integer representation of the year and month extracted from the DateTime column `dt`. 

Please note that this solution assumes that your 'df' DataFrame has been created with appropriate Date type columns. If you have string-encoded dates in your DataFrame, you will need to convert them into Date types first.
